topic: Should Russia adopt a policy of non-intervention in foreign affairs, refraining from involvement in other countries' issues, rather than actively participating in international diplomacy and conflict resolution?

initial_response.English_Speaking: In my view, adopting a non-interventionist stance is not only a reflection of Russia's cultural values but also a pragmatic approach to navigating the complexities of international relations. By prioritizing sovereignty and nationalinterests, Russia can effectively manage its global engagements while minimizing the risks associated with entanglements in foreign conflicts, thus preserving its stability and focus on domestic development.
initial_response.Confucian: My opinion on this matter is deeply rooted in the belief that non-intervention is a path to global peace and respect among nations. By focusing on internal development and maintaining good diplomatic relations without imposing its will, Russia can enhance its reputation as a responsible global player. This approach not only reflects traditional values of sovereignty and self-determination but also aligns with modern ideals of peaceful coexistence and mutual respect.
